page.title: 08SOUTHLANDS FARM (CONT)
page.content: The busiest time of the year is Autumn, because the ground has to be prepared for the seeds to be planted. On their farm, there is no daily routine, but they get up around 6.45 a.m. The straw which is left over from the corn when it has been harvested is baled and stored to put on to a conveyor belt and a machine grinds it, a pipe transfers it into a boiler. The boiler has a furnace inside and it burns the straw, instead of it being burnt in the fields. This also heats the farmhouse. They have two scarecrows, and they employ two bird scarers to shoot the pigeons, to stop them from eating the seeds. They also keep a special corner for wildlife and they are careful about cutting their hedges.
